title: How to Make Fruit Casserole

steps.headline: Place fruit in a large colander and let drain for 30 min or more.
Lightly toast the almonds in a skillet on the stove over medium low heat stirring so as to be careful not to burn.
Using the heavy cream, whip the cream until stiff and keep chilled in the refrigerator.
Gently mix together the drained fruit, toasted almonds and marshmallows in a large mixing bowl until evenly combined.
Beat the egg yolks well with a whisk then add 4T sugar.
Gradually whisk in the light cream and lemon juice into the egg yolks.
Slowly whisk constantly and cook over boiling water until smooth and thick.
steps.description: It should become thick like a custard. Remove from heat and let cool but not set.

steps.headline: Temper custard by stirring in a spoonful of cold whip cream to lighten.
steps.description: Then fold in the rest of the whip cream to combine.

steps.headline: Add custard mixture to the mixing bowl of fruit and gently fold in until well combined and coated.
Pour into a 9"x13"x2" casserole dish and chill 24 hours.
steps.description: Cut into squares to serve or simply scoop out with a large serving spoon.

text: Place fruit in a large colander and let drain for 30 min or more.  Lightly toast the almonds in a skillet on the stove over medium low heat stirring so as to be careful not to burn. Let cool. Using the heavy cream, whip the cream until stiff and keep chilled in the refrigerator.  Gently mix together the drained fruit, toasted almonds and marshmallows in a large mixing bowl until evenly combined.  Beat the egg yolks well with a whisk then add 4T sugar. Place in double boiler. Gradually whisk in the light cream and lemon juice into the egg yolks.  Slowly whisk constantly and cook over boiling water until smooth and thick. It should become thick like a custard. Remove from heat and let cool but not set. Temper custard by stirring in a spoonful of cold whip cream to lighten. Then fold in the rest of the whip cream to combine. Add custard mixture to the mixing bowl of fruit and gently fold in until well combined and coated.  Pour into a 9"x13"x2" casserole dish and chill 24 hours. Cut into squares to serve or simply scoop out with a large serving spoon. Finished.
